text:
FUNDACION CREOLE
Apartado 889
Caracas, Venezuela
November 26, 1957
MTo Harry J. Skomia
Executive Director
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
Urbsna, Illinois*
Dear Mr. Skomia;
I tried to communicate with you when I was in the States a couple of
weeks ago, but they told me that you were then in California*
When I arrived in New York I found that our New York office had made
some contacts with people in the educational T.V. field. Among these were
Mr. George E. Probst end Mr. Seymour N. Siegel. Through them we developed
a working relationship with the Broadcasting Foundation of America, as the
operating agency for the educational T.V. study in Venezuela. It appears
now that they will be able to send Mr. J. R. Winnie, of the University of
Iowa, to work in the project here. It is our hopÂ© that through this agency
we may be able to count on the assistance of the NAEB in any program that
is developed in this country.
I am sorry that I did not get to meet you, but perhaps this might be
dona at some other time.
Very truly yours,
/s/ E* E. Maes
E. E. Maes
Deputy Executive Director
L.
EEMsesk.
Copied NAEB Headquarters 12/3/57dfc
